website_summaries.verdict: If you don't have the need for a lot of wallet space and prefer a low-profile design, you will like this sleek style.
pros: Stands out for its slim design that fits nicely in almost any pocket – especially suited for front pockets
Genuine leather available in numerous color options
cons: Cards "stick" and are difficult to remove
Not ideal for men with a lot of cards and cash to carry

website_summaries.verdict: If you need a wallet designed to tuck into front pockets, you'd have a difficult time finding one with more features and quality for such a low price. Hands down the best value available.
pros: A handsome leather wallet with a sleek, compact build and an affordable price
Features 6 card slots and RFID blocking
Available in more color options than most competitors
cons: Some frayed seams noted after typical use
Slots are somewhat tight, which makes some cards "stick" and difficult to remove

customer_reviews.title: Dont know its in your pocket
customer_reviews.text: This is great slim and just what i was lookong for cant tell its in my front pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Minimal space, excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Good quality material, I am holding 4 credit cards, 1 State ID, 1 DPA, 2 store cards an some cash... Great wallet, minimalist space... Just buy no need to waiver the fence!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A

customer_reviews.title: Moldy wallet
customer_reviews.text: I would like to state I had been looking forward to this wallet all week, I've needed a new one and thought I had found it. No just no. The wallet was packaged nice in a little bag inside of a box inside of a plastic bag, but once I got done unwrapping it I noticed it. At first I thought it was just water spots and would wipe off but after I looked closer it was white/grey fuzzy mold on both sides of it.
customer_reviews.author: Cora

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this wallet when I got it in the beginning and told everyone at my work, they should get one. But after a few weeks, literally bought it in November, the plastic screen for the driver license came out, and then big pocket where you keep your money tore apart. Mind you I work in a hospital and usually keep my wallet in the locker and and I rarely have it on in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Salman

customer_reviews.title: Definitely smaller
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Well made and well designed. Looks great. My work ID still triggers the copiers. Forced me to stop carrying all my credit cards so if it is stolen they aren't all stolen. Fits well in front of work pants. Makes me ponder how much cash to carry. Con: I can't imagine it in the front pocket of jeans Realistic carry is 3 to 4 cards plus license. Three stack on one side doesn't fit but two is great. Have to rethink where to carry receipts and pics of my wonderful kids. Summary: I am using it and it works, and is much less obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!!! Too small and not functional
customer_reviews.text: This wallet only holds an ID and 3 cards. This wallet has literally cost me money at multiple stores now because I can't keep all of my store loyalty cards and membership cards in my wallet anymore. Thus, I have arrived at the store without the card I need and not been able to get my proper discount. As far as cash, it can only hold about 8 bills total because you have to fold them over and jam them into a small, inflexible compartment. The entire wallet is inflexible, barely holds anything, and is completely non-functional for anyone who has more than a couple credit cards or membership cards.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle West

customer_reviews.title: Compact and completely utilitarian
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd give up my back pocket billfold until sciatic nerve pain forced me to reconsider. Now after adjusting to it and wouldn't go back. It has all the pockets and room I need for credit cards, government id-s, and a place to keep receipts until I remove them after I get back home. It protects against theft of your identifty from magnetic stripe readers/thieves.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Fillmann

customer_reviews.title: not durable, stay away
customer_reviews.text: after two month of daily carry, it started to fall apart, the seams are starting to break apart, definitely not durable, I have had wallet that lasted 5 years of daily use and never had it seams fall apart
customer_reviews.author: T. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and Discolored
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Got this for a gift just to see it opened and looking like crap. Returning for a different wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing originally to HOLD MY CASH, along with credit cards, license, and maybe some other item. Since I observed this in the advertisement. Receiving the thing however was a nice box and bag for packaging? WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT FOR? Protection from the boat ride! I THINK there should be some kind of discount because of the trash you get and the agony one goes through! I'm beginning to see why many people are saying along with myself. AMAZON SUCKS
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable, leather wallet
customer_reviews.text: Well, I got tired of carrying my wallet around in my back pocket. That is sooo 1990. So I upgraded to the much sleeker front wallet. I imagine you could put it in any pocket you wanted to, but this holds my driver's license, some cash, and a few credit cards which is all I need for normal every day carry. Much easier to carry, and with jeans getting skinnier and skinnier these days I need all the space I can get. Hope this review was helpful, let me know if you have any questions!
customer_reviews.author: The Fair Critic

customer_reviews.title: Check stitching before committing
customer_reviews.text: I started placing ID and a couple cards in and the stitching failed immediately on the backing sleeve and upon further inspection, the ID pocket itself was held on one side by a single stitch. Craftsmanship on the wallet I received was substandard so durability is questionable. I cannot say it’s a good representation of their product, it’s only one wallet, but I went with something else.
customer_reviews.author: David Sears

customer_reviews.title: Size does matter
customer_reviews.text: I like wallets, since I was a little boy, but eventually my wife convinced me that it was time to change the one I was using. So, I looked all the reviews I could to decide what to purchase instead, and came to the conclusion this Travelambo was the answer to all my needs. Still, when I actually hold it, something was a bummer, it was the same size of my wallet, thinner yes, but the same size. Is it Travelambo's fault, no, it was mine for not looking at the specs, but still I don't feel satisfied. The quality, details, color, material, all that seems very good and durable, but the size is not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Leonel Josué Murillo Retana

customer_reviews.title: I Recived Defacted Unite
customer_reviews.text: I bought two wallets, one of them I found out late that have defected. Because I give it to my Brother as a gift. He told me that there is something wrong with It. Which is made me very angry. You can see in the pictures there is no stitching on the wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Loved the idea but it didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of this and read many reviews before I bought it. Unfortunately it was such a tight fit for my credit cards that I couldn’t remove them. I even tried putting more than one card in each slot, heating a towel and wrapping it around the wallet, hoping that it would stretch it enough to allow me to use the wallet. It didn’t work, so I wrote to the company, via Amazon, and the company refunded my money. I was very impressed with how quickly this was processed and I respect that the company did this. I’m still trying to stretch this creature, but it’s not budging.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy G.

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet just not for blocking rfid
customer_reviews.text: As a small wallet it is great. It stretched out a bit to fit all my cards. It’s advertised as blocking rfid. In my experience it does not. I wanted one that would block rfid while I’m out traveling. I decided to put my rfid badge from work in it and then scanned it with our reader. It didn’t block the rfid at all. If you just need a slim wallet this is great. If your after one that blocks rfid this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Durable and tough! Cards fit great with no bulk!
customer_reviews.text: Love this minimalist wallet! Have tried other ones before and being thin, none held up over time. This wallet you can tell is EXTREMELY durable. The cards slide in and out easily. Love it so much I've ordered several more as gifts and even one for my girlfriend to organize her cards when she doesn't feel like bringing a purse or a clutch.
customer_reviews.author: Kris C.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect wallet
customer_reviews.text: i have had the same leather bifold wallet for over 30 years and it was finally starting to fall apart. My wife kept encouraging me to get something new, but it's hard to get rid of an old friend. i found this wallet and it was priced cheap enough, I figured i could chuck it if it didn't work out. This thing is perfect. holds all of the stuff I had in my old wallet in about half the space. It's light, it organized, and it's almost undetectable in the back pocket. Will it last 30 years? I don't think so, but for now, I'm happy I made the leap and tried something new. It's perfect so far!
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great small low profile wallet (
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this wallet every day for 5 months now. It's help up amazingly well and fits all my cards very well, including: 3 credit cards, 2 photo IDs, health insurance card, 3 business cards, and a hand full of US bills. The crazy horse leather quality seems pretty good. In fact, I'd have to suggest that the leather seems to have softened out with more use. There's no visible scuffs, scratches, or defects after 5 full months of continuous use in jeans, shorts, and dress pants. I feel like this wallet will last much longer than the previous "genuine" leather wallet I had previously. If/when I do need a new one, I'd definitely buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Dash

customer_reviews.title: Don't overfill, but plenty of space for those that can keep it simple
customer_reviews.text: Fits 10 Credit cards and an ID easily. Nothing transmits thru it, my bus card is safe from scammers My Credit Cards are safe from NFC Sniffers Holds a few bucks in cash Allows easy view of ID thru window I've had it for a few months and is wearing well, probably due to size and not overfilling I don't hoard receipts in my wallet or junk that isn't regular use, if you do that, it isn't the wallet for you. Value for the money, I've paid more for less quality. I'm sure that you can buy a wallet for a cheaper amount but the RFID security is worth the few bucks
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Minimalistic; just don’t sit on it
customer_reviews.text: Nice wallet. Slim and holds the essentials. Hate regular wallets and my metal on worth bands is heavier and boxy. Unfortunately, if you sit on this, even for a short period, it will bend the heck out of your cards. The slots all stack like a fan of spots and the pressure will curve them far more than anything else I’ve experienced. I’ll carry it in my pocket, but take it out to sit on it. I know it’s better for posture and back pain, but I was hoping it wouldn’t be a big deal with a slimmer wallet.
customer_reviews.author: FotomanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Yeah... One of the good ones
customer_reviews.text: Well, to start off Im impressed. Far better quality than you might expect. Leather is pretty durable and hold a little more than they say it should. So i keep my license and about 7 cards, along with the occasional dollar or 2. This keeps me from loading up dumb stuff like receipts n crap like that. Very important for me because i have a bad back and a wallet always twists my hips causing pain. This little guy fits in my front pocket and i still have a little room in there for others stuff. Couldnt be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: An alright wallet but only lasted a year before tearing at the seams.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this wallet for roughly a year. And it is very nice to have a minimalist sized wallet versus my normal bi fold or tri fold wallet. The limited size helps make this wallet a dream for those who hate carrying lots of cards. Unfortunately the quality only lasted a year before it started ripping at the seams. Would I recommend it, sure. Just realize that it will only last about a year. Pro: Cards won't fall out. Makes you chose the important cards to carry. Cons: Only last about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Wondering Traveler

customer_reviews.title: I don't know about this
customer_reviews.text: I received this front pocket wallet and I was hoping that it would be great but I'm pretty disappointed. I read a lot of reviews but didn't really see anything about how the cards fit in it. I have noticed that the cards are being slightly pushed upon placing additional cards in the pockets. I will say that it does fit nicely in my front pocket with little bulge. I am going to wait a few more days before I decide to return it or not. (I will update this if I do return it)
customer_reviews.author: Armando

customer_reviews.title: Get this wallet and lighten your pockets!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wallet! I got tired of my pockets feeling weighed down by a thick wallet, so I bought this. I don't know why I waited so long to buy something like this. It has plenty of compartments to put cash or cards in. I use the windowed pocket for my driver's license. The compartments are fairly tight and sometimes I am fumbling to get stuff out, but they seem to have loosened some and made things easier. The wallet looks well made and durable. I think it will be a favorite for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Foster

customer_reviews.title: Gives Meaning to Value Received
customer_reviews.text: I ordered six of these, three in different colors. I’m using them for Holiday Money Gift Cards. A small amount more than paper ones, and a lasting gift. I do a lot of Volunteer work (as do many of my friends) and these are perfect for we gals to keep in a pocket and not have to worry about a handbag getting lost. There could be nothing more beautifully gift boxed than these, an added bonus and a pleasure to give. Five Star Rating is not high enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. T.

customer_reviews.title: My Husband Actually LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband, who rarely likes anything I carefully select for him. He had been complaining that he did not like the wallet he had been using. Too bulky for his front shirt pocket, and no RFID protection. I searched until I found this well designed, leather masterpiece. He has been using it now for several months and has repeatedly told me how much he loves it. This is so out of character for him, so I know he really DOES love it. It is everything it claims to be and then some. The leather is durable but soft and supple. This is a buy you won't regret.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Knox

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for everyday life.
customer_reviews.text: Wearing a traditional wallet was causing many spine issues so I bought this to carry in my front pocket. You'll quickly realize how much junk you carry around when you switch. This little wallet is my everyday carry. Enough room for all the cards I normally use, a little cash, medical cards, spare key, grocery cards, drivers license and dot card. If a truck driver can use it and get essential items in it then it's just big enough. If you've never used a front pocket billfold try this one. Your back will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Berry

customer_reviews.title: Best Minimalist Wallet That I've Carried To Date
customer_reviews.text: Traditional bi-fold and tri-fold wallets always hurt my back when I sit on them, and they're too bulky to carry in my front pockets. This thing has been great. I carry a couple of cards, my ID, and some cash. Everything stays nice and compact and is easy to slip in and out of my pockets. It has been part of my EDC for a couple of months now, and it does not show any signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: AJC

customer_reviews.title: Functional !!
customer_reviews.text: I’m old school and always used a trifold that felt seriously like I was sitting on a brick. I came across this, looking for a minimalist wallet. I keep a drivers license, CCW license, credit card/bank card and $120 in twenties and have room left over. Nice leather, skinny card holder. Can carry in my front pants or shirt pocket and sit comfortably now. Looks nice, feels nice and is very unobtrusive tucked in my clothing. Carries my cards, cash and liceses’s with room left over but that would defeat the minimalist requirement I wanted. Would purchase again! No more bricks for me in my back pocket!!
customer_reviews.author: River Run

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It tore before I even got it in my pocket. The stitch by the drivers license
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unverifiable wallet performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this FRID wallet in order to stop the bad guys from lifting my credit card numbers whenever I travel. Having a credit card company canceling your card mid trip is not my idea of a good time. Unfortunately I cannot vouch for the security of the wallet as I will probably never know if it has deterred any would be thieves. It’s not like an alert is sent out every time someone tries to read a card through the wallet in your pants pocket. The only valid answer to how well it performs is “I haven’t had any fraudulent alerts in the few short that the wallet has been in use”.
customer_reviews.author: Andre S.

customer_reviews.title: Well built, great design and peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This slim wallet is well designed and seems like it is built to last. It's designed with a tight stitching so that cards don't come out unless someone physically pulls them out. The RFID protection will give you a peace of mind. It only takes 2-3 seconds to scan a card's RFID if you've used this feature before when paying, so you can imagine how quickly someone with the right equipment can steal your information if they wanted. I highly recommend this product if you're looking for a slim wallet with RFID blocking protection.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have always carried a standard tri-fold wallet. This encouraged me to carry all kinds of "junk" thinking what if I need it when I was not home. I finally decided to take the plunge and buy one of these. So far I am happy. Since I have only had it for about a couple of months, I can't comment on the long-term durability. I am carrying about 8 credit/debit cards + my DL + some dollar bills + a few thin pieces of document like my health insurance ID card, my auto insurance ID card, etc. I picked the coffee color & it looks stylish!
customer_reviews.author: WorldTraveller

customer_reviews.title: Great way to minimize wife's purse
customer_reviews.text: As a guy I find that I have to either carry a lot of my wife's stuff or even her purse half the time so I got this as a gift so she could minimize the stuff she brings on shorter trips and make it easier on me to just put it in my pocket. So far it has worked like a dream! It isn't bulky and I don't have to have a purse accessory as I walk around Costco. I also liked the RF protection capability in this small form factor. Though I didn't test it I'm assuming they meet the requirements. Great gift for sure and I think it is growing on her for the size and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Lay

customer_reviews.title: Good minimalist wallet but wish it could hold a little more cash
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my old Swiss Navy wallet that I loved after 5 good years and this was one of the first results on Amazon when searching for "Minimalist wallet" and I jumped on it after browsing some of the reviews. Overall, it's a good value for the price and it holds a decent amount of cards/wallet sized photos and ID's but the compartment for cash leaves a bit to be desired in terms of how much it will hold. Still happy with the purchase though.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Sager

customer_reviews.title: Great small wallet!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great front pocket wallet! It is small but will actually hold a decent amount. I have had this one for a while now and it is holding up great. I had bought another brand similar to this one, and it ripped apart in a couple of months, but this one is still going strong after 6+ months. If you want a small wallet that holds up very well I highly recommend this one. At the price point I don’t think you will get any better. Heck I don’t think you get any better at a higher price point.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Very compact, efficient & light
customer_reviews.text: Its a reasonably attractive, very efficient, small, thin, and light way to carry up to five items of credit cards, room key card, perhaps a key or two, plus a couple of bills, unobtrusively, especially when you are on a short excursion and only need a minimum of cards and bills while keeping your other cards and cash at home or in your hotel. Its so little and light it is easy to hide or pack in a shirt pocket next to a phone, and remember where it is. Rustic leather, as small as it can be, no room for much ,ūa passport. Fits a shirt pocket, will not scratch a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice wallet
customer_reviews.text: It has one more slot than my husband's previous wallet and it seems to be ever so slightly easier to get the cards out. We do wish these minimalist wallets would add about 1/16 of an inch for all slots. Although you want the cards to stay in, you do want to be able to easily get them out. It would also be helpful if Travelambo would tell us which fabrics are easier to use. I have a feeling that not all the fabrics are the same in terms of how easy it is to maneuver the cards in or out of the wallet.
customer_reviews.author: kitty

customer_reviews.title: Black Travelambo Medium size Front Pocket Minimalist Slim Wallet with RFID Blocking
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product 5 Stars because it is very thin, made of Genuine Leather, RFID Blocking and 6 compartments. This wallet is very handy and can fit in the front shirt pocket or just about any kind jacket or coat pocket and can hide very easy in a purse or some compartments in the car. I'm very happy with purchase, it's giftable and great value for the money, Travelambo Brand also has an assortment of colors to choose from, I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: oscar

customer_reviews.title: Right handed wallet, but still good
customer_reviews.text: This wallet is for right-handed people. I didn't realize that when I purchased it. Otherwise, it's good quality, has a slim ptofile, and holds everything I need in a wallet. I got a different wallet to use daily, but this should be a good back up if my other fails. The only reason is that I would have to hold it upside down to slide my ID card out with my dominant hand and if I've stretched out the credit card pockets too much (over time), I'd risk letting cards slip out. Nite a huge problem since the user could judt adjust their wallet-holding habits, but I'm a creature of routine and know I'd be disatisfied over time.
customer_reviews.author: Lit RoxTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the money
customer_reviews.text: For what you pay for this, you can't beat the quality and usability. The leather is not completely tanned, but not quite suede either. It makes it easy to carry in a front pocket, with just enough resistance on the draw to prevent it being slippery when it exits the pocket. It accommodates several credit cards, some cash, and a few odds and ends like medical card, CCW permit, fishing license and insurance card. If you are a pack-rat, it won't hold all you are hording. It is for the essentials, which is just what I needed it for. It mates well to my few other pocket carry items. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave 0194

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a marvelously slim and light wallet that is now my everyday wallet. I got it for travel (and I cannot speak to the RFID-blocking feature, which I assume works but I have no way to test it), but it's so comfortable that I kept using it after my trip. Mine routinely can hold 4 or 5 credit cards, 3 slimmer medical-insurance cards, 2 business cards, a driver's license and 8 dollar bills (I just counted). Comfortably fits in my front pants pocket which most wallets cannot do. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: megamiddlemyth

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet, very happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this wallet. I came from a Big Skinny wallet, I prefer a very thin wallet since I only carry 2 credit cards, a debit card, license, and some cash. I don't carry much at all, but I'm also not keen on using a phone case/wallet combo either. This ended up being the perfect combination of slim-ness and capacity for me. Very happy with this, and it includes the RFID blocking as well which is something I never had before. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Great little front pocket wallet!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wallet to carry my ID’s, check card, and a little cash. My bifold wallet seemed to aggravate my sciatica and so I want to switch to carrying my wallet in my front pocket. It is also handy when I am in my gym shorts as it is lighter and thinner than a traditional wallet. The wallet seems to be just big enough to carry all the essentials and seems to be well made and of study design. I would recommend to anyone needing a small front pocket wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist for the win!
customer_reviews.text: I've always carried pretty much everything in my wallet. Started out with a trifold, slimmed down to a bifold, and now this minimalist wallet. I love it! I have my DL and LTC in the I.D. slot, main cc in the slot behind those. 3 cards in the individual slots and a handful of insurance/misc cards in the other main slot. I'm not a big cash person, but I do currently have 2 bills in the main compartment, with room for more. It's very snug! Unless the stitching comes undone, I don't see anything falling out. For $7, I'm beyond happy!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great Wallet very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Wallet, very nice material, has lots of spaces to put your credit cards cash and other things. It also keeps these securely in place so you don't have to worry about something falling out when putting it in your pocket or taking it out. The thing design is nice when putting your wallet in a safer place such as your front pocket to prevent pick pocketing. Also sitting on your wallet can be pretty uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for carrying a few cards and little cash
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice minimalist wallet for anyone that just carries a few cards and little cash. I found that a drivers license, three thin insurance cards and three credit cards were about as much as I could comfortably keep in it. It would be possible to cram in more cards but the wallet starts to bulge and it becomes difficult to access anything else that might be kept in the other pockets. Because of this, it was just a little too small for my needs. The Crazy Horse Khaki is an attractive color. The wallet appears to be well constructed. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone who carries less than me in their wallet.
customer_reviews.author: tlinn-com

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT wallet!
customer_reviews.text: I like a thin wallet as I only carry the bare essentials. This carries everything I need and makes everything easily accessible, along with some cash. Very comfortable in my back pocket and the ID pocket has a hole to make it easy to slide your ID out when necessary. Excellent construction. I retired my other wallet to my travel drawer to use as a "dummy wallet" for pickpockets to take when traveling as I'll never go back to the bulkier wallets!
customer_reviews.author: Karma Yoakem

customer_reviews.title: The color leaches into the credit cards
customer_reviews.text: After using this wallet for 2 months I noticed that my cards have streaks on it from the dye in the wallet. Can't seem to erase it.
customer_reviews.author: Woo Kim

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for a minimalist!
customer_reviews.text: I gave three of these as gifts...only one has gave me feedback and he loves it. He says he is amazed by the amount of bills he can carry it. His son-in-law bought him a very nice leather wallet but he prefers this little wallet to carry in his front jean pocket or shirt pocket or even inside jacket pocket. He said it was lite-weight it does not pull on fabric or weigh down shirt pocket...So if you have a minimalist...this is a gift they would appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Mango Lover

customer_reviews.title: Tried many, this is the best hands down!
customer_reviews.text: I'd tried multiple slim wallets. A $90 Tumi and , returned both. The Travelambo gets 5 stars b/c it's 3.3" X 4.1" X 0.12" whereas the wallets I returned were close to the same range of 4.4 " x 3.15" x 0.12". The 3.3"w is a HUGE difference over the 4.4"w in how it fits in your pocket. The Travelambo is slim and feels like the width of a Samsung S7 phone. I also like the fact that cash (folded) slides in and out very easily b/c of the lining. Do not waste your time trying other wallets, get this one at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Spoof

customer_reviews.title: There is an alternative to sitting on a fat wallet
customer_reviews.text: This little item is terrific. I actually have given myself some back problems over years of sitting on my wallet. My doctor and a physical therapist suggested a smaller flat credit card holder for my front pocket. Until now I didn't know how convenient a front pocket wallet really is to carry. Wish I had made this purchase twenty five years ago. Has it cured my back issues? Nope but they are not getting worse and at the end of long drives I don't need to spend ten minutes stretching next to the car before walking away. This is certainly a lot less expensive than a visit to my doctor's office and several to a physical therapist's.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Like most who want to downsize their bulky wallets, I was looking for one that I could carry my license, and a few cards. I saw this Travelambo front pocket slim wallet, read the other reviews so I thought I would try it. It is perfect for what I need. It holds everything securely, has plenty of slots and comes in a beautiful deep khaki color. It arrived in a nice box, and was packaged with a cloth "case." I have used it now a few weeks, and I don't see any reason I won't be using it years to come. A great product at a fantastic price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: My husband likes it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, and he likes it. He wanted something smaller for taking to work. It's perfect for what he wanted, he can carry a few cards and a bit of cash. He also carries a few hearing aid batteries in it, and that works fine, too. It looks pretty nice. The leather looks better than I expected. I don't know if it's real leather or not, I'm never sure if they're telling the truth with these things, but it looks and feels nice enough. It doesn't look cheap. He's happy, I'm happy, and I feel it was well worth what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This minimalist wallet was a little too “minimalist” for me. For the wallet to not become too bulky you really only want to put cards in the slots and not try to store any in the sleeve. The main reason for this the low rating is this wallet advertises being able to hold a few bills in the middle. However even having a single bill in it, you have to fight with the wallet to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Slim design
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with the bad points since theres very few and I'll finish strong with the good ones BAD: 1. Quality of materials is okay seems as though a 1 year life will be the most I can yank out of the wallet. 2. A bit pricier for what it is. The GOOD... 1. Block rdif as mentioned. 2.slim design . 3.non leather option for all those animals lovers out there. 4.good value against other brands. 5.good customer service in case theres an issue. There you have it and I hope I've managed to help you
customer_reviews.author: Obarel

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet
customer_reviews.text: Great little wallet. The leather has scratched a little bit as it is pretty soft leather, but I think that gives it more of a rustic/worn look so I’m good with that. The credit card slots are very firm and tight so you don’t have to worry about any of your cards slipping out. They are stitched tight unlike other wallets where they tend to stretch over time. I like this wallet for the price, and it looks great. Only reason I’d give it 4 stars is due to how easy it scratches.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN M.

customer_reviews.title: Its a wallet
customer_reviews.text: Half the size of my old one, held everything from my old one except a couple cards I had just never gotten around to throwing away. Won't hold a lot of cash, but that's not a problem for me. Has a thread pulled, but it may have got caught on a screwdriver or something else in my pocket. Leather looks a little odd from sweat getting on it. I'm really hard on things in dumb ways, you'll probably never have an issue
customer_reviews.author: clay hunter

customer_reviews.title: Small yet holds quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: Color: Crazy Horse Deep Brown The wallet itself has (1) clear windowed wallet for an ID, (3) Card Pockets, (2) General use pockets, and (1) Pocket best to hold cash. I'm currently holding 7 cards, and 7 bills (folded in half), a small photograph, and 2 post-it notes. The total filled thickness is 1/4" (one-quarter inch). Cash is easy to retrieve as well as the cards The wallet did include an informational card. Per the card, Travelambo will offer a one year warranty for any product deduct.
customer_reviews.author: Buster

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I finally realized over all these years that I don’t need a bunch of stuff in a wallet. All I need is my ID, two credit cards and my movie card. This is perfect for all that. It’s light weight and small enough for my front pocket, which helps relieve the pressure on my sciatic nerve in my back pocket. It also has a pocket to keep a receipt, coffee card, business cards or whatever else you need to store for a few days. I’m a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Minimalist Wallet
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, I just got it today and it already feels much higher quality than my last wallet. My brother actually has a wallet by travelambo and I was so jealous of the quality that I needed to buy my own! I recommend it for any teenager or someone who doesn't like having a ton of cash on them. Carries 6 cards or maybe 8 if you stuff it. That includes ID. My rating is 5/5 would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: JAVATAL

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great slim wallet. Fits all my cards with some cash without it being too difficult to access them when I need it. I can’t speak on durability because I haven’t owned it for that long. If I get at least 1 year out of it, I think it’s a great buy for the price. As far as RFID blocking, it’s nice to know that it has it although there is no way of me testing to see if it works. Overall I would recommend if you’re looking for a slim wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Djbeez77

customer_reviews.title: the best!
customer_reviews.text: i got this wallet to keep in the tiny pocket of my work pants. in it, i have 9 cards and it can also hold quite a few bills and even coins. it sticks out halfway from my back pocket while i work, but even squatting down it doesn't fall out. it has made it so i don't need to keep my purse around at all times and i can bring it anywhere quite easily. the material seems quality and the clear id pocket is easy to slide a card in and out from yet keeps your card snug and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for minimalistic wallet for a bit of cash, ID and a few cards. Love this thing. I carry 7 cards including ID (health debit account, health insurance, AAA, credit, debit, driver's license, etc.). They fit fine in the wallet and the most used are easily accessible. I barely feel it in my pocket. Access to the cash pocket is a bit of a squeeze but for me, cash is kind of quaint and more and more seldom used. No regrets. I'd buy this thing again.
customer_reviews.author: Stu in Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Few hours in and exactly what I was looking and hoping for!
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today, first impressions are excellent! Passes the smell test and have been using it for a few hours now around the house. Exactly what I was looking and hoping for right now. I was initially sent the wrong wallet but got that cleared up and back in the mail the next day. it was a Huskk BrandI'm not going to cover that too deeply but I wouldn't have used that wallet for anything important if it was free.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The ALMOST Perfect Wallet.
customer_reviews.text: This wallet is so close to perfect. Its great if you don't have many cards and/or cash, but if you fill all the card slots and you have some cash in the wallet, you're going to have quite a hard time pulling any cards or cash out. I have to risk bending my debit card to get it out because of how tight it gets, even if I don't have any cash in the wallet! If the wallet was a little looser, it would be my favorite wallet.
customer_reviews.author: John Bryant Jr

customer_reviews.title: Its slim and perfect to slide in my front pockets
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because Its made in China. I wont know if in time the quality of this wallet will hold up to my expectations. Its slim and perfect to slide in my front pockets. Good leather color. Im hoping the plastic holds on and wont crack quick. Good price. Keep in mind you get what you pay for. Im comparinn it to my old Fossil wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Compact and smooth
customer_reviews.text: Buying this wallet without feeling it in my hand, did make me take pause. I was not sure it would be large enough and one picture seemed to show the paper currency, as if it were the length of the wallet, unfolded, of the $100 bill. Bills must be folded, but it works fine, and they slide out easily. The dimensions are given with the description 4.1 inch length. It all works well and I love for the price. Nice leather, compact, and smooth. I chose Crazy Horse Coffee--beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love this wallet
customer_reviews.text: I've given it heavy use for the past 4 months. I'm surprised at how good it still looks for the price. Definitely something worth getting. The wallet looks like it can only hold one card per slot, but I've been able to fit 2 on each slot at different times. The size profile is smaller than a traditional wallet in every way. I expected it to feel flimsy or loose within my back pocket but it does not. It feels pretty solid. Definitely worth a buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Robles

customer_reviews.title: One of the cards gets stuck due to glue
customer_reviews.text: The last card in the back of the 3-card stack always gets stuck. I had a hard time pulling the card out regardless of what card I out in there. Upon closer examination I found out that there is a glue residue on the edges near the seams. I am not sure how am I going to get the glue out. It might rip if I try to get it out of the tight cornet. Other than that the wallet would have been perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: kgman

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to access cash.
customer_reviews.text: For 10 bucks it was worth seeing if I liked this style of wallet. I have a leather tri fold, and already carry around very few items. The cash is easy to access with the trifold, but it becomes a 2 handed operation with this wallet. Not a design problem, just a preference problem. If you don't use cash very much, this might be for you. The size of the wallet is bigger than my trifold, but much thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity at its finest
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure the price could be way cheaper than it is but that’s my only complaint. The wallet is small and fits nice in the pocket like it’s not even there. I only have like 5 cards so it fit all in the wallet, a couple bills and a photo of my family. I recommend this to anyone who wants a simple wallet that has 3-5 cards and does not carry a lot of bills
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for My Son and he loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son is 30 years old and like most folks his age does not want to carry much. Certainly he does not want the kind of wallets my husband uses. This wallet was made of leather, had space for his ID to easily show, and plenty of space for credit cards (and what little cash he would ever carry which he rarely does). Good quality leather as I opened it before I forwarded it on to him.
customer_reviews.author: Weanling

customer_reviews.title: Small, simple and stylish!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality. It's stylish, yet simple. Just what I was after. I was having a lot of back pain and my doctor told me to stop carrying my wallet in my back pocket because it messes up my posture. I keep this little guy in my front pocket now with just a couple credit cards, my driver's license and some cash. I can tell a difference in the way my back feels now that I don't carry that old bulky wallet around and sit on it all day!
customer_reviews.author: Dave V.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: As a product, I have zero complaints, it looks nice, works great, etc. But it's really not for me. It's just too small for my comfort - since it has virtually zero weight, you can't feel it in your pocket... causing me to CONSTANTLY check my pocket to see if it had fallen out. So I switched back to my full-sized wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great compact wallet! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wallet! I've had mine for 6 months and just ordered a second one. I'm still using the first one which is black and I have seven cards in it plus $300 in twenties in it. I ordered a second one in brown to put more cards in it. So the black one will be more my personal one to carry mostly then the brown one will carry cards I don't use much (insurance, AAA, etc) but need occasionally. This will allow me to completely replace my traditional wallet that's makes me feel like I'm sitting on a hump. I will be able to carry both of the compact wallets in my front pockets.
customer_reviews.author: RichD

customer_reviews.title: Still too small.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that the billfold did not hold the number of credit cards that it claimed. I presently have a pocket billfold that I like, but it just didn't hold a reasonable number of cards. I liked the appearance of this one in the illustration and description, but it did not meet expectations. Also, I ordered a tan leather one, but received a fabric one.
customer_reviews.author: Being Heard

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, recommend it
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent little wallets for wearing in your front pocket. I hate a wallet in my back pocket. These fit just the right amount of necessary cards and cash without any bulk. If you enjoy having 50 business cards in your wallet don't purchase this. I used one for about 2-3 years before having to replace it for another $12.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Slim profile
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim profile. I dont like a huge thing bulging out of my backpocket. This is perfect... holds my ID with clear cover, so i dont have to take it out on most places where I'm carded (clubs, bars, etc). You do have to take it out of the airport since they scan your drivers license. I don't carry a lot of cash, so I just put a $20 or $50 as emergency in it. I pay mostly with card.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Gumabong

customer_reviews.title: Should Work Nicely On My Next Trip
customer_reviews.text: Usually, when we travel out of the country, I take at most three credit cards and one ID(with exception of the PassPort. This RFID wallet is smaller and thinner than I anticipated. Recently purchased a hidden runners body pack with zipper pockets (to be worn around the stomach) to take on foreign trips - this thin wallet fits perfectly in the zipper pocket of that device. Can't wait to give the wallet a try. Also, pretty stylish by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Dec

customer_reviews.title: Thin, Functional Wallet
customer_reviews.text: The wallet is thin, fits easily in front pocket or back. Don't even know I'm carrying it most times. The only drawback for me is I don't like having to pull all cash out of the wallet to find the specific dollars I'm looking for but I guess that's the price of a a thin, light and functional wallet. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Techguy1724

customer_reviews.title: Substantially less bulky than even a bifold.
customer_reviews.text: Three and a half weeks into using this wallet and I'm impressed with it's ultra slim profile. I'd say it can handle 6 to 7 credit cards with ease. Everything stays snug in its slot, don't worry about things falling out, they won't. Seems like it will last as long as a typical leather bi or trifold. I've subtracted one star for the semi-cramped bill pouch since it takes a bit adjusting to folding paper money in half or thirds before placing it into the wallet. I'd recommend if you're tired of bulky wallets.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Keep Your Man Card and Get a Great Wallet
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a fan of this wallet. Holds cards tight so no chance of them sliding out after owning for some time now. Even went through the wash and was as good as new. Enough spaces for everything I carry: 2 ID's, 6 cards, receipts etc. I also have back problems so had to switch to a front pocket wallet. It doesn't bulge my front pocket out, even in dress pants. Color is sleek and goes with everything too. I thought this was for guys with skinny jeans only but as a beard sporting, steak eating, Grizzly bear wrestling man, boy was I wrong. In all seriousness, great buy, A+.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy 2020
customer_reviews.text: I love this wallet feels great and I don't have to worry about someone taking it while I'm on vacation. Holds all my bank cards, cash and I had no idea how much stuff I was carrying that I didn't need in my wallet. Money well spent. Fella's you need one of these. FYI my butt & lower back feels alot better too.
customer_reviews.author: GrimReaper

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This product is beautiful and hefty. It is slim and fits in my front scrubs pocket perfectly. I am a woman so my pockets aren’t as big as some, yet it fits perfectly. The wallet is very well made and has a beautiful design on all three of the interior pockets. The front slot is for your ID and three slots on the back for credit cards. I love the fact that there is three pockets in the middle for money or receipts! The material seems like it will withstand quite a bit!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Happy
customer_reviews.text: While I rarely leave reviews, I felt that this one was warranted. I recently put my 15 year-old Coach credit card wallet through both the wash & rinse cycles. A replacement Coach was $85 so I decided to go cheaper (getting close to retirement). We’ll see how it holds up, but I’m really impressed. The leather is nice & the stitching is perfect. The packaging was overkill nice...ziplock bag>nice box>cloth pouch>wallet. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist wallet
customer_reviews.text: Great minimalist wallet. I've owned a few different minimalist wallets in the past, most with a mix of leather and cloth. I've found that wallets with cloth will stretch with time. Unfortunately this means were you to reduce the number of cards used, the cloth is now loose and the remaining cards are at risk of falling out. This doesn't have those issues. I comfortably fit several credit cards in the slots. I like the front transparent ID holder. I like the slot for cash as well. It isn't uncomfortable to carry around in my pockets and does what I want it to do.
customer_reviews.author: frabjousdayTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's a Wallet!
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I was looking for. A very thin wallet to minimize what I keep with me. The RFID addition is cool, but never worried about someone stealing my $9 left after taxes and bills. Cost is fair, color selection is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Combat Munkey

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, Good quality, Average price
customer_reviews.text: For those who are into the cards lifestyle, this is your wallet. Slim, it looks nice, it has several divisors, durable, safe, light. I don't really know if it is worth the $10 dollars only time will tell how bad it will wear off. But I really think that the money they have spent to make this item has been going into the making, designing, and materials instead of the brand.
customer_reviews.author: CaliUser 2017

customer_reviews.title: My butt got smaller lol
customer_reviews.text: This wallet is very small compared to my old one but it keeps me from hoarding crap that I dont need anyway. Takes time to get used to but it's much more efficient than the older bible I call it with money credit and essentially needed cards it's about 3/4" compared to almost 2 inches thick or more would definitely recommend to keep things organized.
customer_reviews.author: Vince v v

customer_reviews.title: Nice wallet
customer_reviews.text: I try to carry as little as possible and this is just the wallet I needed. I have one card in each pocket, so a total of 5 cards and then my ID in the clear one. I currently have 2 gift cards in the center pocket with plenty of room for more or some cash but I’ve had 10 US bills folded in half comfortably in there. You are able to fit 2 IDs in the clear pocket, 2 cards in the side pockets but I’d say only 1 card in the 3 card setup. All my cards fit currectly in their pocket and have none sticking out more then they should.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Very small- not a regular wallet.
customer_reviews.text: Very small and cheaply made. I was very disappointed but as I bought them (4) for Christmas gifts, I can’t send them back. Gift cards barely fit, and it doesn’t even look like wallet read description carefully- this is not a regular wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Best minimalist wallet ever
customer_reviews.text: Best minimalist wallet ever. Not many wallets out there that can fit as many cards and has an ID window, which I was specifically looking for. In the beginning, it really is a minimalist wallet. It starts out really stiff and I can barely fit a couple bills after I put in all 8 of my cards. However, after a good month of a break-in period, I can put in 15 bills folded in half. I would not keep that many bills in there because it makes it bulky and I feel like it will not last as long.
customer_reviews.author: J. Phu

customer_reviews.title: I finally found the wallet I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a slim wallet for years. This is the one. I can fit 6 cards, license, registration/insurance, and 6-10 bills with room for more. I haven't tried adding more cards yet, but it seems to have been broken in after about a month and ready for more cards. I love the look and feel of this wallet, and after a month and a half it still looks great. I'm very happy with this wallet.
customer_reviews.author: ASG

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well over more than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a huge bi-fold wallet kinda guy, but wanted something that was less of a literal pain in the ass. This fit the bill, small and sturdy. Can't fit a purse worth of stuff into it, but I like that it forces me to keep things simple and neat. I did not expect it to hold up this well, just passed the 2 year purchase anniversary for this one.
customer_reviews.author: cekseh

customer_reviews.title: Hold more than expected comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: Wallet easily holds 4 cards plus dl, and 14 folded bills. Just give it a few days to stretch out. One modest disappointment: the coffee color is very dark, darker than i wanted. Maybe some wear spots will improve my perception of it. The alternative colors did not look any lighter on my monitor. Other than that a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This wallet has two things to improve: 1. ...
customer_reviews.text: This wallet has two things to improve: 1. Not enough compartments. When I move from my old wallet to this wallet, several things can't even fit into. 2. The leather is too thick. Therefore, the wallet becomes quite thick after money and credit cards are placed inside. Much thicker than my old wallet with the same content inside. It produced a big bump on the pocket pants and made me feel uncomfortable. After using it for a few days, I decided to switch back to my old wallet.
customer_reviews.author: GreenTea man

customer_reviews.title: I love this minimalist wallet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for a trip so I could carry just the basics, and I loved it so much that I've been using it ever since. I can slip it in a back pocket without pissing off my sciatic nerve, and it works well even in women's pocket deficient pants. Good quality and the material of the wallet has a nice feel, too.
customer_reviews.author: xen

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this Waller now for a month to replace my two fold wallet I had for 7 years. Wow! This product is really well built and convenient to carry around; it made me minimize the amount of cards I carried around but I realize I didn’t need the extra cards. Product also looks great!
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

product_meta.title: Travelambo Front Pocket Minimalist Leather Slim Wallet RFID Blocking Medium Size(02 CH Coffee)
feature_bullets: 1 YEAR QUALITY PROTECTION, our quality protection covers any defect caused during product production and delivery. We can offer you full refund or free replacement, whichever is at your most convenience.
SUPER MINIMALIST & SLIM: only 0.12" thick, sizing 3.3" X 4.1" X 0.12" extremely convenient to be carried around in your front or back pocket. 100% GENUINE LEATHER: soft and durable.

RFID BLOCKING TESTED & APPROVED BY INDEPENDENT LAB TESTS. Our wallets have been tested for 13.56 MHz Frequency in which our credit cards, debit cards, driver license and ID cards operate. PLEASE BE NOTED THAT the signal of some ID badge, access cards and hotel room cards which operates in 142 KHz, can not be blocked by this wallet.

ENHANCES PERSONAL SECURITY: We leverage top RFID technology to block RFID signals used to electronically scan your wallet as someone passes by unnoticed. This keeps your vital information in driver license, debit cards and credit cards from being stolen.
P FUNCTIONALITY: Our RFID wallet not only offers security, it's also very functional. It features 6 card slots for you to place your most frequently used cards.
